question.body: What score (after rounding) must a student have in order to be in considered for the engineering school?

response.feedback: Correct. In order to be in the top 2% of SAT-M scores (and thus be considered for the engineering school) a student must score more than 2.05 standard deviations above the mean. 2.05 standard deviations above the mean is a score of 507 + 2.05(111) = 734.55. Since SAT-M scores are whole numbers, we conclude that in order to be considered for the engineering school a student must have an SAT-M score of at least 735.
